intro: Trichopteryx camerunensis, commonly known as the Cameroon thornapple, is a flowering plant native to Cameroon and adjacent regions of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed-like species. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, opposite leaves, and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as savannas and woodlands. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal uses, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
